page.title: 14THE BROOK PRIMARY, WORDSLEY
page.content: The Brook Primary School has flourished under a number of names during its 100 years existence. It commenced its service as The Brettell Lane School under the control of the Kingswinford School Board on Monday August 21st,1882, under the mastership of B.F.Mason, Trained Certificated Teacher,(First Division,1878,Saltley). The school was later known as Kingswinford Wordsley Brook Street Council School,the Brook Street Junior Mixed & Infants School and finally as now, The Brook Primary School. The school still flourishes today and in 1982 in order to celebrate its centenary a document was published. In it the present day Head stated. "It is comforting to know that the Brook has such a fine heritage; something of which pupils, teachers and parents can be justly proud."
